title: Operations Manager
description:
About Us

Pepper Foster Consulting is a strategy and project execution consulting firm headquartered in Portland, OR, with offices in Portland; Minneapolis-St. Paul, Minnesota; Atlanta, Georgia; and an M&A practice. We are a values-driven firm with a focus on utilizing local people for local work while also having the ability to provide services coast to coast in the United States internationally as needed. We specialize in helping our clients turn their ideas and concepts into transformative realities, and we exist to make a difference - for our clients, our people, and our communities. Founded in 2015, our consultants have been trusted to advise, elaborate, and lead the strategy, analysis, and execution of a host of mission-critical initiatives and projects for our clients.


DEI Vision Statement

Pepper Foster recognizes that diversity, equity and inclusion extends but is not limited to culture, race, religion, veterans, gender, sexual orientation and physical ability. We are inspired by the unique communities where we live and work, and embrace diversity as vital to the health of our organization. We are driven by relentless curiosity and a strong desire to educate ourselves, build awareness and encourage continuous learning. We strive to provide a culture that is open, compassionate and respectful of all people.


The Position: Operations Manager


To support our growth as one of the Inc 5000 fastest growing companies in America, we are creating the new position of Operations Manager.


You’ll be part of the HQ team and work directly with the founder and CEO of Pepper Foster Consulting and our executive leadership team to manage and execute our day-to-day operations and critical back office functions.


This is a hands-on, multifaceted role where you will be responsible for invoicing, bookkeeping, financial reporting, payroll, new employee onboarding, HR and benefits administration, website and marketing administration, new laptop setup, and administering our Google, Microsoft, SalesForce, Employee Navigator, and Bamboo IT systems.


You will be an invaluable and integral part of the team, at the center of everything, and probably the first person people go to when they need help or have a question.

You’ll get to experience and grow your skills in just about all of the critical back office functions of a business including Marketing, IT, HR, Finance, Payroll, Employee Growth & Development, and Training.


As the company grows, so will the operations functions, providing you with opportunities to grow your career; maybe by focusing on one of the functional areas like HR, IT, Finance or Marketing; or maybe by staying in a multifaceted operations role that could one day lead to you becoming a CAO or COO.

The Person: Fun, Smart, Collaborative, Detail-Oriented, Flexible, Dedicated


Minimum Requirements

  • You have at least 2 years of professional experience in a similar multifaceted role within a professional office environment.
  • Experience with bookkeeping, payroll, benefits, marketing, and/or IT administration is a big plus.
  • Located in the greater Portland area or willing to relocate
  • Must be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship


Preferred Qualifications

  • You are fun, smart, honest, passionate, collaborative, humble, thoughtful, flexible, confident, generous, inspiring, great, and happy.
  • You are naturally detail-oriented and have high standards for the quality and accuracy of your work.
  • You are a fast learner and enjoy figuring stuff out, getting stuff done, and tackling a wide variety of tasks.
  • You relish tracking down and fixing problems, working out how to make something work in a system or process, or fit and look good on a website, and sometimes, you lose track of time when you’re writing copy, creating spreadsheets, developing reports, making graphics, or updating websites.
  • You are ambitious and keen to grow your career and understand that you have to build your skills and abilities and prove that you have the right stuff to move ahead.
  • You naturally look for ways to improve things, streamlining processes and creating reusable templates to make your work easier and more efficient.
  • You care about how things are received and look and take pride in making sure your work is received well, looks great, and is of the highest quality it can be.
  • You have a natural eye for design and are a great communicator with a writing style that is easily consumed by all and inspires curiosity, interest, and confidence.
  • You are flexible and comfortable being uncomfortable, enjoy helping people, and your energy is contagious.


The Opportunity: To grow your skills and career at a forward-thinking and rapidly growing firm, working with great people who enjoy making a difference


The reason you’ll join the Pepper Foster team (apart from the fact that we’re awesome) is that you’ll gain visibility into and experience in all of the critical back office functions of a business.


You’ll be able to grow your skills in a wide variety of functions, work out what you enjoy the most, and take your career forward in a host of different ways.


Your role will be what keeps the company moving forward and, as a result, you will be at the center of everything. You will get to work directly with and learn from senior leadership and the whole team.


You’ll be joining a firm that has an amazing culture, great team, celebrated leadership, and a vision for one day being one of the largest and most important companies of the 21st century.


Benefits of Working for PFC


  • Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Life & Disability Insurance
  • Flexible Paid Time Off
  • 8 Flexible Holidays
  • Paid Volunteer Time
  • Annual Performance Bonus
  • FSA Plan
  • 401(k) Plan with Employer Contribution
  • Cell Phone Reimbursement
  • Paid Parental Leave & Adoption Benefit
  • Stock Options
  • Profit Share Points
  • $2,500 Annual Professional Development per Employee
  • All Expenses Paid Annual Retreat + Monthly Social Activities


Base Salary Range

$65,000-$85,000/Annually


Pepper Foster Consulting is an equal opportunity employer. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
ZARA IS LOOKING FOR AN FRONT DESK RECEPTIONIST BASED AT OUR NYC CORPORATE OFFICE (NOT REMOTE).


Started in 1975 in Spain, ZARA today is an internationally known fashion retailer represented in over 88 countries around the world. Our company requires professionalism, imagination, high energy and team spirit. ZARA will give you the means to excel. ZARA will put you into the heart of the action and the heart of its growth.


FRONT DESK RECEPTIONIST

Position based in our NYC Corporate Office (NOT REMOTE)


We are seeking a highly organized and detail oriented Corporate Office Manager to oversee the daily operations of the cooperate office. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing administrative tasks, coordinating office procedures, and ensuring the smooth functioning of the office environment. Office manager maintaining efficient communication channels, support staff members, and implement office procedures.


Responsibilities:


  • Manage and supervise receptionist.
  • Oversee day-to day office operations including maintenance of office equipment, supplies and facilities.
  • Plan and coordinate in-house or off-site events and meetings.
  • Maintain the office condition and image, supervising services and arranging necessary repairs and extra cleaning services.
  • Assist with office layout planning and moves.
  • Work with building coordinator to coordinate visitors access, use of common spaces, and maintenance.
  • Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence.
  • Ensure all invoices related to office spending are billed and paid on time.
  • Keep updated records and files of office expenses and cost.
  • Coordinate domestic ground transportation reservations.
  • Work closely with travel agency to respond and resolve traveler’s request.
  • Maintain Travel platform (Concur) up to date and provide functional support to users on booking and expense system.


Personal profile:


  • Prior experience in similar role in a fast-paced environment is essential (min. 2 years).
  • Degree in business administration, hospitality management or related field.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication. English is essential (Spanish is a plus).
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Word, and Excel).
  • High level attention and accuracy in record-keeping.
  • Analytical skills to interpret data and generate insightful reports.
  • Positive attuite and professional demeanor.
  • Customer service oriented.


Annual compensation range: $58,667 - $66,000 + discretionary annual bonus

Actual compensation within that range will be dependent upon the individual’s skills, experience, qualifications, and applicable laws.


Our company requires professionalism, imagination, high energy and team spirit. Sounds like you? THEN, APPLY NOW ONLINE TODAY!

title: Health Educator/Training + Design Specialist
description:
Job Description

GENERAL DUTIES:

The Training + Design Specialist will be responsible for developing and delivering sexual and reproductive health training (both in-person and virtual) and technical assistance to health care professionals and other key stakeholders across the country; organizing and facilitating webinars on sexual and reproductive health and justice topics; designing workshops; developing new curriculum, training tools, and e-learning content; and other special projects as assigned. The Training + Design Specialist will be a member of the capacity building division of the organization (The Learning Exchange). This position is based in the organization’s Los Angeles office with a hybrid remote/in-office work schedule. The salary range for this is position $80-85k

SPECIFIC DUTIES + RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Design, develop and deliver in-person and virtual trainings and workshops in the field of sexual and reproductive health (SRH) in both English and Spanish (preferred) for diverse internal and external audiences.
  • Provide support for implementation of capacity building efforts (training, webinars, technical assistance etc.) through developing agendas, coordinating with partners, scheduling trainings, managing registrations, maintaining training records etc.
  • Contribute to the design and production of training materials in English and Spanish (preferred) including participant manuals, visual aids, job aids, tool kits, videos and e-learning modules, etc.
  • Assist in the development, planning and launch and marketing of new Spanish-language trainings, webinars, and resources. Bilingual candidates to assist in the translation and facilitation of Spanish-language trainings and resources.
  • Support division-wide efforts in data collection, evaluation and project planning including review of course evaluation feedback and by implementing quality assurance reviews.
  • Support our annual Sexual Health Update Conference planning team with development of agenda and negotiations with speakers; write bios and workshop descriptions; coordinate and collect presenter materials, handouts and presentation; moderate conference sessions and panels.
  • Monitor project and contract scopes of work, timelines and budgets as assigned.
  • Collaborate with internal teams in the Programs + Strategic Initiatives Department to assist in the development of course content as well as training staff around best practices in public speaking and training facilitation skills.
  • Knowledgeable in the tenants of health literacy in order to convert complex medical information into accessible and understandable content for diverse audiences.
  • Responsible for staying up-to-date on evidence-based best practices in the field of SRH through conference and webinar attendance and regular review of journal articles and new and emerging data.
  • Evaluate, amend and revise division-wide materials with relevant clinical updates, evidence-based approaches and new best practices as needed and on an ongoing basis.
  • Assist with assessment of learner feedback and implementation of improvement plans to address learner needs.
  • Complete assigned reports as required. Support marketing of programs and other LE-related services.
  • Coordinate continuing education reporting for Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) in conjunction with our agency Continuing Education Committee.
  • Additional duties, as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform this job.

  • Fluent in English and Spanish (preferred).
  • Degree (Bachelor’s or Masters) in public health, health education, nursing, or related field; or equivalent years of experience.
  • 2-3 years’ experience in the field of sexual and reproductive health or related field.
  • 2-3 years’ experience developing course materials and delivering training for adult learners.
  • Proficient with Zoom platform (meetings, webinars, recordings, team chat, whiteboard, etc.)
  • Experience with course authoring tools (e.g., Camtasia, Storyline, Captivate) and learning management systems for developing and hosting interactive e-learning modules.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft (Excel, Word, Power Point) and Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop, Acrobat) computer software.
  • Experience developing, implementing and evaluating training programs for adults.
  • Demonstrate independent decision making per scope of work.
  • Work with culturally and linguistically diverse groups.
  • Management of meeting logistics.
  • Ability to create positive working relationships.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and/or in a team setting.
  • Excellent organizational skills and adept at working on multiple projects.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:

A current California Driver’s License, current registration and current automobile insurance coverage is required if you drive on company business. Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) certified applicant preferred.

Company Description

About Essential Access Health

Mission: Essential Access Health champions and promotes quality sexual + reproductive health care for all

Essential Access Health (Essential Access) achieves its mission and advances health equity through a wide range of programs and services including clinic support initiatives, provider training, advanced clinical research, advocacy, and public awareness campaigns. Essential Access operates the Title X federal family planning program in California and Hawai'i and serves as the lead fiscal and program administrator for state-supported funding streams that support access to abortion and birth control for individuals with low-incomes seeking these essential services in California.

Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Justice + Inclusion

Essential Access was established in 1968, grounded in the belief that everyone has the right to access the health services and information they want – with dignity and respect. Although significant gains have been made in expanding access to essential health services over the past 50 years, true progress cannot be attained without confronting and addressing racism, advocating for equity and justice for all, including the LGBTQ+ community and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to integrating a health equity lens into our policies and broad range of programs and services and taking meaningful action to promote equitable and optimal sexual and reproductive health outcomes for all.

Join Us

With offices in Northern and Southern California, our dedicated staff are leading experts in the field of sexual and reproductive health – as researchers, trainers, health care leaders, and more.

title: Coordinator, Digital Content
description:
Cavaliers Holdings LLC is committed to delivering epic experiences for our fans, team members, community, and the world. Fueled by a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture, we strive to recruit individuals that will be enthusiastic and purposeful in carrying out our vision as Transformative Leaders in Sports and Entertainment. If you are ready to work in the fast-paced and high-energy setting of the Cavs, Monsters, Charge, Legion and Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse— then we want to talk to YOU!

Position Summary

The Cleveland Monsters and Rocket Entertainment Group Franchise Properties are looking for a talented Digital Content Coordinator and editor who can help drive engaging and impactful content through the Cleveland Monsters digital and social media channels and maintain a professional appearance to team digital communications. The ideal fit for this role is a creative content mind who is a self-starter, is organized, understands the online culture of the sport and keeps a close eye on the evolving trends of social media and video development. The ideal fit recognizes the important role digital content plays in support all areas of our business, and has aspirations to grow as a well-rounded marketer.

This position, based at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse, will report to the Director of Communications & Community Impact, Cleveland Monsters. This role will work closely with creative teams and counterparts in digital content, graphic design, FieldHouse Creative, and communications, as well as digital leads within the organization, on an on-going basis.

A main focus area for this position will be assisting with content creation as directed by team leads. Content may include social posts, webpages on clevelandmonsters.com, the Monsters Mobile App, graphics, video, e-mail communications, and game coverage. This person will work with existing brand guidelines to create content that fits the brand’s voice and aesthetic. This individual will be relied upon to contribute ideas and best practices relative to the digital space. This position will work with departmental leads to help populate and maintain a digital content calendar for the Cleveland Monsters. Another key focus of this position will be providing general support for the Monsters Communications team and lending similar support as directed for Cleveland Charge initiatives.

This person is required to be at all Cleveland Monsters home games at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse and will be asked to help with select road game coverage remotely (no travel required). On game days, this position will support the needs of the Monsters PR & Communications team.

The Digital Content Coordinator should be proficient with a number of creative applications that will be key to the role, including but not limited to Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop, TikTok, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

This is an entry-level role seeking minimum 6 months experience.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Consistently meets, works with, and develops strong relationships with team members across departments by being engaged and involved with team activities. Has finger on the pulse of these initiatives and executes through proactive thinking, creativity and innovation.
  • Possesses an overall positive attitude while managing multiple projects across different franchises and departments.
  • Helps to provide social media and PR coverage for roughly 50% of Monsters away games from home.
  • Actively seeks out new and innovative ways to engage with our fans in the digital space.
  • Provides new ideas of how to compliment or elevate team initiatives through digital activation.
  • Supports the efforts of our Ticket Sales and Corporate Partnerships teams by promoting key initiatives and activation of contractually obligated partnership elements.
  • Actively recaps and communicates the impact of the team’s digital activity, including regular reporting to team leaders.
  • Exhibit compelling storytelling through all content and platforms.
  • Captures, produces, and edits video and photo content for team social media and digital channels.
  • Ensure all content is on-brand, consistent in style, quality, and voice.
  • Contribute to digital, marketing, and creative brainstorming sessions.
  • Works with corporate partnerships team to plan, execute, and track contracted partnership activation in the digital space.
  • Maintains and builds library of high quality images for marketing & social use


Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in communications, marketing, social media or related field is required.
  • Minimum 1 year experience in Premiere, After Effects and Photoshop.
  • Must provide link to portfolio or relevant work for consideration.
  • Experience in managing social accounts for a brand, especially in sports, is a plus.
  • Strong creative thinking and ability to plan and propose new ideas.
  • Ability to act as on-camera talent at in-market events a plus.
  • Creative and strategic in nature with an understanding of how to turn access into content.
  • Desire to seize opportunities and take initiative without needing to be told.
  • Must be organized, highly motivated and team oriented.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented workplace.
  • Maturity, professionalism, and a strong work ethic are essential.
  • Must be able to work non-traditional hours including evenings, weekends, and holidays on short notice as required.
  • Must provide link to portfolio or relevant work for consideration.


We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

Apply Now

title: Virtual Booking Assistant-ENTRY LEVEL (Remote)
description:
Join us as a Virtual Travel Booking Assistant, where your main task revolves around ensuring travelers have a seamless and memorable journey. Embrace remote work and utilize digital tools to assist clients with their travel arrangements.

Responsibilities:

  • Client Engagement: Interact with clients via email, phone, or chat to grasp their travel requirements. Tailor personalized recommendations and itineraries to suit their preferences.
  • Research and Planning: Dive into extensive research on destinations, accommodations, transportation, and activities to craft bespoke travel plans. Stay informed about travel trends and restrictions.
  • Booking Services: Secure reservations for flights, hotels, rental cars, tours, and other travel services, always aligning with the client's preferences and budget.
  • Travel Documentation: Aid clients in obtaining essential travel documents, visas, and insurance. Offer guidance on passport and visa prerequisites.
  • Budget Oversight: Assist clients in managing their travel budgets by presenting cost-effective options and highlighting potential expenses.
  • Travel Itineraries: Develop detailed travel schedules encompassing daily activities, dining reservations, and client requests.
  • Problem Resolution: Tackle any travel-related issues or emergencies during the client's trip, such as flight disruptions or accommodation hiccups.
  • Customer Support: Deliver exceptional customer service, maintaining a positive demeanor and promptly addressing client queries.
  • Documentation Management: Keep meticulous records of bookings, client preferences, and communications for future reference and follow-up.

Requirements:

  • Superb communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong organizational and time-management prowess.
  • Passionate about travel with a solid understanding of various destinations.
  • Adaptability and effective problem-solving abilities.
  • Previous experience in travel or virtual assistance is advantageous but not obligatory.
  • Flexibility to accommodate different time zones or handle emergencies.
  • Reliable high-speed internet connection and a distraction-free workspace.

Perks:

  • Remote work flexibility promoting a healthy work-life balance.
  • Access to exclusive travel perks, discounts, and romantic offerings.
  • Opportunity to contribute significantly to creating unforgettable romantic experiences.
  • Continuous training and professional development opportunities to hone your skills.
  • Collaborative team environment fostering creativity and growth.
  • Competitive compensation package with performance-based incentives.

Benefits:

  • Flexible Schedule
  • Travel Perks
  • Licensed & Bonded
  • Personal Website
  • E&O Insurance with Fraud Protection
  • Daily Training Available
  • Travel Agent Certification
  • Remote Business Opportunity
  • Full Training Provided
  • Work FT or PT
  • No experience necessary

title: M&A Development Director
description:
M&A Development Director

São Paulo, Brazil

Our client is a multinational company specialized in the corporate service industry, operating worldwide. Based on innovation, ambition, and integrity, it’s an expanding company active in more than 120 countries with over 70,000 FTE´s globally.

Due to their expansion, they are now looking for an M&A Development Director (job creation) who will be responsible for identifying and evaluating potential M&A targets that align with North America's strategic goals. Key responsibilities involve market screenings, strategic and financial analysis, negotiations, pre-selection processes, stakeholder management, discussion facilitation, internal collaboration, and senior management reporting.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct comprehensive market screenings to identify potential M&A targets in accordance with company objectives and growth strategies.
  • Lead the pre-selection process of potential targets through strategic fit analysis, considering factors such as market positioning, product portfolio, geographic presence, and synergies.
  • Perform initial financial profile analysis of potential targets, including financial statements, valuation metrics, and potential risks.
  • Initiate one-to-one negotiations with pre-selected targets, demonstrating a clear understanding of their business operations, objectives, and value propositions.

This is really a great opportunity for a driven professional that wants to be part of an ambitious organization and highly motivated team, with lots of opportunities for personal and professional growth.

Location: Houston, Texas.

title: Director of Creative Ops
description:
Company Profile:

At CAVA we make it deliciously simple to eat well and feel good every day. We are guided by a Mediterranean heritage that’s been perfecting how to eat and live for four thousand years. We prioritize authenticity, curiosity and the pursuit of excellence in everything we do. We are working towards something big, together.


We foster a culture built on five core values:

  • Generosity First, Always: We lead with kindness. Our best work happens when we act in service of others.
  • Constant Curiosity: We are eager to learn, grow, and explore beyond the obvious.
  • Act with Agility: We welcome change; it’s the only constant. We embrace, adjust, adapt.
  • Passion for Positivity: We greet each day with warmth and possibility.
  • Collective Ambition: We have high aspirations that are achieved when we work together with a shared purpose.



Director of Creative Operations


CAVA is looking for a Director of Creative Operations to lead our end-to-end in-house creative team operations — from briefing through execution and implementation — including but not limited to project management, budgeting, resourcing, and system management in efforts to ensure efficiency, help with prioritization, and set up team to develop best in class creative work.

A Creative Operations Manager is the glue that holds the Creative team together and is the constant source of truth for the projects they manage. They need to be the ultimate team player: dedicated, hard-working, and able to maintain and share their positive attitude. They ensure that projects run smoothly and are delivered on time and on brief, while making sure all team members have the support and information they need. The ideal candidate approaches each task, small or large, with the same attention to detail and follow through. They thrive off creating systems and optimizing processes, all to drive clarity and efficiency, not only on their direct team but with cross functional teams as well.


As a seasoned professional in creative operations, you will play a key role in driving the success of our brand creative, ensuring efficiency, quality, and creative excellence throughout.


What You’ll Do


  • Partner closely with Creative, Cross-Functional, and Executive Leadership to drive creative and brand alignment and decision making
  • Introduce operating models and practices that help our team achieve exceptional outcomes, quickly
  • Lead strategic design initiatives in partnership with design leadership peers
  • Lead the day-to-day operations of the Creative Operations team, driving an evolution where the team can improve
  • Oversee the execution of brand and marketing campaigns across design, copy, photo and video production, and content.
  • Facilitate collaborations between Creative, Brand, Digital, and the larger Experience Team, as well as cross-functional partners and departments
  • Build an atmosphere of collaboration. Build bridges between people and teams. Lean into and resolve conflicts when needed
  • Collaborate with the team to drive prioritization and staffing decisions
  • Mentor and guide your individual team members on our most complex projects, and help them achieve their individual growth goals
  • Own relationships with third-party agencies and freelancers, and facilitate these collaborations
  • Own our budget and partner with creative leadership for annual budget planning
  • Own and drive communications to keep the team informed and motivated


Core Functions


  • Operational Strategy Development: Develop and implement operational strategies that support product creative and marketing objectives, ensuring alignment with overall business goals.
  • End-To-End Process Management: Manage, coordinate, and optimize the briefing process by acting as a helpful conduit between brief writers and the creative team
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Foster strong collaboration and communication across cross-functional teams, including creative, marketing, production, and project management, to ensure seamless workflows and creative excellence.
  • Resource Allocation: Manage resource allocation and capacity planning, including the assignment of creative teams and resources to projects, to optimize productivity and meet project deadlines.
  • Process Optimization: Continuously evaluate and refine creative processes, workflows, and tools to enhance operational efficiency, quality, and innovation.
  • Budget Management: Oversee budgets for creative projects, ensuring responsible allocation of financial resources and adherence to financial goals.
  • Performance Metrics: Establish and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of creative operations, and use data-driven insights to drive improvements.
  • Vendor and Partner Management: Collaborate with external vendors and partners as necessary, negotiating contracts, managing relationships, and ensuring high-quality deliverables.
  • Team Leadership: Provide leadership and guidance to a team of creative operations professionals, fostering a culture of creativity, accountability, and continuous improvement.
  • Compliance and Quality Assurance: Ensure compliance with industry standards, legal requirements, and quality assurance protocols in all creative operations.
  • Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to safeguard project timelines and creative deliverables.
  • Technology Integration: Explore and implement innovative technologies and tools to enhance creative operations, productivity, and collaboration.


About You


  • 7+ years of experience in creative operations, project management, or a related role.
  • 4+ years of people management experience
  • Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and develop a high-performing team.
  • Exceptional strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
  • Proficiency in project management software and creative collaboration tools.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong working relationships across diverse teams.
  • Budget management experience and financial acumen.
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
  • Knowledge of industry best practices and emerging trends in creative operations.
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • A bias for action. You operate with a distinct sense of drive, and you help your team do the same.
  • Sweat the details. You understand the details can make or break a project.
  • Skilled facilitator. You’re able to operate at all altitudes within an organization—from driving team workshops to executive reviews.
  • An optimist. You see the positive in situations, and encourage others to see it too.
  • Mentor for your team. Your team learns, grows, and becomes better versions of themselves by working with you.


Physical Requirements:


  • Ability to maintain stationary position to be able to operate a computer and other office equipment
  • Must be able to identify, analyze and assess details
  • For certain positions, must be able to occasionally move or transport items up to 50 pounds
  • Ability to communicate with others and exchange information accurately and effectively
  • Constantly positions self and move about to support ordinary restaurant or food production support or office operations, as applicable
  • Ability to work in a constant state of alertness and in a safe manner
  • What we offer:
  • Competitive salary, plus bonus and long-term incentives*
  • Unlimited PTO, paid parental leave, plus paid opportunities to give back to the community
  • Health, Dental, Vision, Telemedicine, Pet Insurance plus more!
  • 401k enrollment with CAVA contribution
  • Company-paid STD, LTD, Life and AD&D coverage for salaried positions*
  • Free CAVA food
  • Casual work environment
  • The opportunity to be on the ground floor of a rapidly growing brand

*Indicates qualifying eligible positions only, and conditions may apply



CAVA – Joining “A culture, not a concept”



As an equal opportunity employer, CAVA considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, age, height, weight, marital status, sexual orientation, familial status, genetic

Area of Interest Behavioral Health – Non-Nursing;

FTE/Hours per pay period 0.6;

Shift 1st/2nd shifts, rotating weekends, 24 hours per week;

AbbeHealth Services - is a regional nonprofit organization dedicated to providing mental health and aging services that help individuals achieve their optimum levels of independence and success.

Crisis Services are designed to assist individuals who are in a mental health crisis and need a supportive environment and staff to help them work through the crisis. We provide a stable and consistent environment to adults who are experiencing a mental health crisis in a community setting 24 hours per day 7 days per week.

Why UnityPoint Health?

  • Culture – At UnityPoint Health, you matter. Come for a fulfilling career and experience aculture guided by uncompromising values and unwavering belief in doing what's right for the people we serve.

Hear more from our team members about why UnityPoint Health is a great place to work at https//dayinthelife.unitypoint.org.

  • Is aware of department compliance requirements for federally funded healthcare programs (eg. Medicare and Medicaid) regarding fraud, waste and abuse. Brings any questions or concerns regarding compliance to the immediate attention of department or administrative staff.

  • Skill development interventions with the individual and documenting observable behaviors and symptoms.

Bachelor’s degree in social work, nursing, psychology or other human services related is preferred. Highschool diploma or 2- year Associates degree will be considered.

Two years of relatable work experience in mental health and other human service-related positions. Iowa Driver’s License required.

$10,000 Sign-on Incentive For Qualified Applicants!

title: Accounts Payable Specialist
description:
Ferretti Search is delighted to partner with our client to locate their next Accounts Payable Specialist.

    • Ability to work collaboratively in a team, adapt to feedback, and incorporate changes into designs.
    • Strong attention to detail. Organized and reliable. Able and willing to present designs to groups of stakeholders.

    Preferred Skills

    • Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS and responsive design principles

title: Expression of Interest - People and Culture Manager
description:
We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.

The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:

  • Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.
  • Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.
  • Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.

The F4S Talent Pool process:

Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.

About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)

Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high-performing teams.

Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.

Your feedback is a gift! Write to us via: to help co-create the future of recruitment, together.

title: Junior Web Developer
description:
Junior Web Developer (1 year experience, hybrid)

Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. Well compare your skills and experience against both current and future needs. If theres a match, well contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from US/Canada residents during the application process.

Base Salary: $57K-$67K Per Annum.

Description:

title: Senior Vice President Field Operations
description:
A US-based company is recruiting for the position of Senior Vice President Field Operations.



The Senior Vice President Field Operations, a senior executive role, oversees the day-to-day operations of a company, ensuring its overall efficiency and effectiveness.


Operational Leadership: Senior Vice President Field Operations is responsible for providing strategic leadership and direction to all operational departments within the organization, including production, sales, marketing, finance, human resources, and logistics. They oversee the execution of operational plans and ensure that goals and objectives are achieved.


Process Optimization: Senior Vice President Field Operations identifies opportunities for process improvement and implements strategies to enhance operational efficiency. This includes streamlining workflows, eliminating bottlenecks, reducing costs, and implementing best practices to drive productivity and quality.


Performance Monitoring: Senior Vice President Field Operations establishes key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the performance of various operational areas. They regularly monitor and analyze these metrics to assess the company's overall performance and make data-driven decisions to optimize operations.


Strategic Planning: Working closely with the Senior Vice President Field Operations and other executives, the Senior Vice President Field Operations participates in the development and execution of the company's strategic plans and initiatives. They provide input on operational feasibility, scalability, and resource allocation to support the company's growth objectives.


Cross-Functional Collaboration: Senior Vice President Field Operations fosters collaboration and alignment across different departments and functions within the organization. They work closely with other senior leaders to ensure seamless coordination and integration of operational activities, promoting a unified approach to achieving organizational goals.


Risk Management: Senior Vice President Field Operations identifies and manages operational risks and develops strategies to mitigate potential threats to the company's operations. They establish robust internal controls, compliance processes, and contingency plans to ensure business continuity.


Team Management: The senior Vice President Field Operations is responsible for building and leading a high-performing operational team. They recruit, train, mentor, and evaluate team members, promoting a culture of excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement.


Stakeholder Management: Senior Vice President Field Operations interacts with various stakeholders, including board members, investors, clients, suppliers, and regulatory bodies. They represent the company in external forums and build strong relationships to support the organization's strategic objectives.


Overall, the Senior Vice President Field Operations plays a critical role in overseeing the operational aspects of a company, driving efficiency, and ensuring that all functions work together harmoniously to achieve the organization's goals.

title: Sales and Dealer Development Manager
description:
Summary

Job Description

This position will establish, control, and oversee the activities for Kärcher Municipal Dealer Development, Sales, Marketing and Dealer Product Training. The primary focus will be the sale of Kärcher Municipal Equipment in the assigned Area of Responsibility (APR) in the AFL Dealer Territory for Kärcher Municipal. Secondary will be the establishment of an Industrial dealer network across the United States. (Dealer Network not currently established)

This position is for an individual that is looking to take their entrepreneurial expertise to a whole new level. This is a new industry for Atlanta Fork Lifts, Inc. and it creates the opportunity to build out a new business unit. It is a unique opportunity for someone that wants to create something from scratch and grow it into a thriving dealer network across the US.

Job Description

The position will develop and implement goals and objectives to meet strategic planning and profitable growth objectives for our company. This includes working with management on business planning, forecasting, budgeting, and expense control. This position will also assist with developing marketing material to promote equipment sales.

This position will also work with Parts, Service, Rental, and Used Equipment Sales to develop a fully rounded dealership and dealer network. Dealer network will require warranty, technical support, parts support, and distribution, etc. Position will be supported locally by Atlanta Fork Lifts, Inc., and Internationally by our manufacturer, Kärcher Municipal North America (KMNA) who is headquartered in Canada, and Boston, MA.

Work Experience/Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in business related field preferred
  • 5+ years’ experience in Material Handling Equipment or Industrial Sales

Skills·

3+ years’ experience in managing/mentoring others.

  • 3+ years’ experience in managing/mentoring others.
  • Extensive knowledge of Industrial Floor Cleaning & Street Cleaning Equipment
  • Demonstrate good leadership and decision-making skills.
  • Work effectively and interact with multiple levels within our organization.
  • Ability to read and interpret financial reports.
  • Excellent oral and written communication, organization, and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Business Programs
  • Good driving record
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Competitive spirit

Company Description

Toyota Material Handling Systems is a Family owned business that was founded in 1973. We represent Toyota Industrial Equipment, the world’s largest forklift brand. We pride ourselves on providing world-class service to our customers at four facilities in Georgia. We have been recognized by Toyota for 15 consecutive years of Service Excellence and the prestigious ASEC award for outstanding customer service facilities and customer service.

title: Administrative Assistant

Nemas International is looking for an administrative assistant to join our team remotely. This person will work to support the daily operations of the office.

title: Mid Market Account Director - Talent Solutions
description:
Company Description

LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description

At LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams. This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can both work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what’s best for you and when it is important for your team to be together.

We are looking for an Account Director to join our team as a trusted adviser with a relentless focus on bringing value to our customers within Mid-Market sector. You will be responsible for helping our customers effectively engage with our solutions (Talent & Learning). You will be dedicated to making our customers stronger and seeking out opportunities for growth. Although you possess a strategic approach to selling and strive to meet/exceed revenue goals, you will always have your clients’ best interest in mind and act as their internal advocate to ensure they are set up for success.

Responsibilities:

  • Researches Customer’s business and prepares thoughtful questions and insights in advance of customer meetings
  • Asks layered, open-ended questions to understand and clarify Customer’s objectives and challenges beyond surface-level detail
  • Builds relationships with multiple stakeholders (vertically and horizontally) across the Customer’s organization
  • Shifts communication style and content to fit the needs of different stakeholders
  • Leads with Solutions, not products, when making recommendations aligned to Customer objectives
  • Sells with Integrity
  • Drives customer decision making by achieving shared vision and proactively considering the value props that tie all stakeholders together
  • Thinks commercially and applies business acumen when crafting & negotiating commercial agreements
  • Uses data and insights to support investment recommendations or overcome customer objections
  • Proactively mitigates churn risk by adopting a smart, customer-centric approach
  • Engages customers throughout to confirm and clarify value and adapts a strategy when needed to optimize ROI
  • Drives Customer growth by proactively identifying opportunities to deliver greater customer value
  • Applies business acumen in Account Planning by considering economic, industry, and company factors with a Customer-centric lens
  • Maps all key stakeholders in an account to assess the strength of the account relationship and create account outreach strategy
  • Agrees to joint accountability with colleagues and cross-functional teams for optimal customer success
  • Practices humility and asks for help from colleagues when faced with a challenge or unknown
  • Is disciplined in Territory and Account Planning, Forecasting, and Quota Attainment
  • Follows best practices when using CRM and other Sales tools in order to manage the Sales and Buyer cycles

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of applicable sales experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with HR software
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent in a related field
  • Experience with SaaS opportunities and Dynamics/D365 platform
  • Experience selling IT solutions
  • Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions
  • Strong negotiation and accurate forecasting skills
  • Experience carrying a revenue target with the ability to develop compelling strategies that deliver results
  • Excellent communication, negotiation and forecasting skills
  • Demonstrated ability to find and manage high-level business in an evangelistic sales environment
  • Ability to gather and use data to inform decision making and persuade others
  • Ability to assess business opportunities and read prospective buyers
  • Ability to orchestrate the closure of business with an accurate understanding of prospect needs
  • Ability to include multiple partners and members of the company management team using competitive selling to position company products against direct and indirect competitors

Suggested Skills:

  • Sales Prospecting
  • Business Case Preparation
  • Multithreading
  • Influence at all levels
  • Active Listening

LinkedIn is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

The pay range for this role is $122,000 to $175,000. Actual compensation packages are based on a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years & depth of experience, certifications and specific office location. This may differ in other locations due to cost of labor considerations.
